LanguageData.Animal_Flu.label: flu
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.description: An infectious disease caused by the influenza virus. This strain is adapted for infecting non-human species.
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.extreme.label: extreme
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.label: plague
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.description: An infectious disease caused by bacteria. This strain is adapted to infecting non-human species.
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.extreme-0.label: extreme
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.extreme-1.label: extreme
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.label: fibrous mechanites
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.description: Semi-coherent mechanites which develop fibrous links in muscle tissue. They enhance the victim's strength, but also cause intense pain. These are probably a mutated strain of strength-enhancing mechanites.
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.stages.mild_pain.label: mild pain
LanguageData.Flu.label: flu
LanguageData.Flu.description: An infectious disease caused by the influenza virus.
LanguageData.Flu.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Flu.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.Flu.stages.extreme.label: extreme
LanguageData.GutWorms.label: gut worms
LanguageData.GutWorms.description: Parasitic worms in the gut. They cause vomiting. They also consume the victim's food, which increases hunger.
LanguageData.LungRot.label: lung rot
LanguageData.LungRot.description: A bacterial disease that targets an individual's lungs. Minor cases are little more than an irritation, but if left unchecked the bacterial growth results in an increasing amount of fluid buildup in the victim's lungs, eventually resulting in death.\n\nIf treated properly, the body's immune system will eventually clear lung rot.
LanguageData.LungRot.descriptionShort: A painful bacterial disease caused by exposure to rot stink gas. Upon reaching full saturation, it will kill the affected individual.
LanguageData.LungRot.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.LungRot.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.LungRot.stages.extreme.label: extreme
LanguageData.LungRotExposure.label: rot stink exposure
LanguageData.LungRotExposure.description: Long-term exposure to rot stink gas. Rot stink exposure has no direct health effects. However, serious rot stink exposure has a chance to result in a painful bacterial infection known as lung rot. When not exposed to rot stink gas, rot stink exposure will slowly decrease.
LanguageData.LungRotExposure.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.LungRotExposure.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.LungRotExposure.stages.serious.label: serious
LanguageData.Malaria.label: malaria
LanguageData.Malaria.description: An infectious disease caused by a mosquito-borne parasite.
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.extreme.label: extreme
LanguageData.MuscleParasites.label: muscle parasites
LanguageData.MuscleParasites.description: Parasitic creatures in the muscles. These cause weakness and a lack of coordination.
LanguageData.Plague.label: plague
LanguageData.Plague.description: An infectious disease caused by bacteria.
LanguageData.Plague.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.Plague.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.Plague.stages.extreme-0.label: extreme
LanguageData.Plague.stages.extreme-1.label: extreme
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.label: sensory mechanites
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.description: Semi-coherent mechanites which reside in the nervous system. They enhance the victim's senses, but also cause intense pain. These are probably a mutated strain of sense-enhancing mechanites.
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.stages.mild_pain.label: mild pain
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.label: sleeping sickness
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.description: An infectious disease caused by an insect-borne parasite. Sleeping sickness is not as deadly as some other diseases, but progresses slowly. The body takes a long time to clear the infection.
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.minor-0.label: minor
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.minor-1.label: minor
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.extreme-0.label: extreme
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.extreme-1.label: extreme
LanguageData.WoundInfection.label: infection
LanguageData.WoundInfection.description: Bacterial infection in a wound. Without treatment, the bacteria will multiply, killing local tissue, and eventually causing blood poisoning and death.\n\nThrough aeons of human warfare, infections have often taken more lives than the wounds themselves.
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.minor.label: minor
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.major.label: major
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.extreme-0.label: extreme
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.extreme-1.label: extreme
